FuncDef:
The ospf timer poll command sets the poll interval at which Hello packets are sent on an NBMA network.
The undo ospf timer poll command restores the default value. The ospf timer poll command sets the poll interval at which Hello packets are sent on an NBMA network. The undo ospf timer poll command restores the default value. The default interval is 120 seconds.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a poll interval.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 3600, in seconds.

ExtraInfo: On an NBMA network, if a neighbor is invalid, the device sends Hello packets to the neighbor at the poll interval set using the ospf timer poll command. The poll interval must be at least 4 times the Hello interval.
